data.name: KnappTitle
data.value: Residence Process in Austria

data.name: KnappWelcome
data.value: Welcome KNAPP Austria team

data.name: KnappMyName
data.value: My name is Lucas Hafner, I am a .NET developer.

data.name: KnappWifeInfo
data.value: I am married to Sofía Arzamendia, an Italian (naturalized) citizen, who is also in your selection process.

data.name: KnappIntro
data.value: I understand you'd like to know if I can be employed despite not being an EU citizen myself.

data.name: KnappOptimisticMessage
data.value: The short answer is yes! Not only is it possible to employ me without a work visa, but I can handle the entire process myself, and it can be completed within just a few business days.

data.name: KnappStepsNotice
data.value: Here is a step-by-step breakdown of the process I will personally follow (counting business days).

data.name: StepsTitle
data.value: Steps to follow

data.name: Day1
data.value: Day 1

data.name: Day1Details
data.value: We arrive in Austria and enter together: she as an EU citizen with her Italian passport, and I as her husband, an Argentine citizen. Although we are already married, I am considered a tourist until she registers her residence.

data.name: Day2
data.value: Day 2

data.name: Day2Detail1
data.value: We register our address (Meldezettel) at the local municipality.

data.name: Day2Detail2
data.value: My wife applies for the Anmeldebescheinigung as a resident EU citizen.

data.name: Day3
data.value: Day 3

data.name: Day3Detail1
data.value: Once my wife obtains her Anmeldebescheinigung, I can apply for the Aufenthaltskarte (residence permit as a family member of an EU citizen).

data.name: Day3Detail2
data.value: After that, a confirmation of application in progress can be requested, which allows me to work in Graz.

data.name: TravelQuestion
data.value: Can I travel alone within Europe and nearby once employed?

data.name: TravelAnswer1
data.value: Yes, as the husband of a European citizen with legal residence in Austria, I can travel alone within the Schengen area for business or tourism.

data.name: TravelAnswer2
data.value: As an Argentine citizen, I can enter the Schengen zone visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period, which allows short trips with no problem. Although my wife’s residence does not grant me special entry rights, my Argentine passport allows me to enter as a tourist or for temporary business.

data.name: TravelAnswer3
data.value: I only need to carry a copy of our marriage certificate and documents proving the family relationship.
